sentences: Harald Sokal (born 18 March 1954) is an Austrian jazz saxophonist.

His most recent band project is the group Depart, an energetic saxophone trio with Jojo Mayer on drums and Heiri KÃ¤nzig on bass, which was founded in 1985 and revives the alpine music tradition with the most varied forms of contemporary jazz.

He has collaborated with a variety of European and American jazz musicians including Art Blakey, Wolfert Brederode, Dave Holland, Terje Rypdal, Daniel Humair, Michel Portal, Mike Richmond, Mino Cinelu, Friedrich Gulda, Idris Muhammad, Joe Zawinul, Harry Pepl, Gene Jackson, and Andy McKee.
The Minimalism of Erik Satie (Hat ART, 1984)
Wolfgang Ambros, Es Lebe Der Zentralfriedhof (Bacillus/Bellaphon, 1975)
Arik Brauer, Geburn Fur Die Gruabn (Amadeo, 1988)
Michael Mantler, The Jazz Composer's Orchestra Update (ECM, 2014)
Wolfgang Puschnig, Two Songs for Another Lovely War (Ex Zed, 1988)
Jasper van 't Hof, On the Move (Intuition, 2015)
Peter Wolf, Poetic Sound Music for Lovers and Loosers (Intercord, 1975)
